query: Can u recommend some films for people who like action movies ?

choices.reason: Contains information about films, including titles and descriptions.
choices.summary: This table contains information about films available for rent, including their titles, descriptions, and various rental details. It is typically used to manage and display film inventory in a rental system.

columns.name: film_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each film.

columns.name: title
columns.description: The title of the film.

columns.name: description
columns.description: A brief summary of the film's plot.

columns.name: release_year
columns.description: The year the film was released.

columns.name: language_id
columns.description: Identifier for the language in which the film is available.

columns.name: original_language_id
columns.description: Identifier for the original language of the film, if different.

columns.name: rental_duration
columns.description: The number of days the film can be rented.

columns.name: rental_rate
columns.description: The cost to rent the film for the specified duration.

columns.name: length
columns.description: The duration of the film in minutes.

columns.name: replacement_cost
columns.description: The cost to replace the film if lost or damaged.

columns.name: rating
columns.description: The film's content rating, indicating suitability for different audiences.

columns.name: special_features
columns.description: Additional features included with the film, such as deleted scenes.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp of when the film record was last updated.

choices.reason: Links films to categories, useful for filtering action movies.
choices.summary: This table links films to their respective categories, allowing for the organization and classification of films. It is typically used to query films by category or to analyze category distribution across a film database.

columns.name: film_id
columns.description: The unique identifier for a film.

columns.name: category_id
columns.description: The unique identifier for a film category.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp when the record was last updated.

choices.reason: Contains categories of content, including action movies.
choices.summary: This table contains information about different categories of content, such as movies or shows. It is typically used to organize and classify content for easier navigation and searching.

columns.name: category_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each category.

columns.name: name
columns.description: The name of the category.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The date and time when the category information was last updated.

choices.reason: Tracks actors in films, providing context for action films.
choices.summary: The film_actor table represents the relationship between actors and the films they have appeared in. It is typically used to track which actors are associated with which films and when this data was last updated.

columns.name: actor_id
columns.description: The unique identifier for an actor.

columns.name: film_id
columns.description: The unique identifier for a film.

columns.name: last_update
columns.description: The timestamp of the last update to this record.

choices.reason: Provides detailed information about films, including titles and descriptions.
choices.summary: This table contains detailed information about films, specifically their unique identifiers, titles, and descriptions. It is typically used to retrieve and display film-related data in applications and databases.

columns.name: film_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for each film.

columns.name: title
columns.description: The name of the film.

columns.name: description
columns.description: A brief summary or synopsis of the film.
